result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip Barnes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
PROBATION CONDITIONS (and Extended Supervision if revoked):
No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant for his physical or mental health  by a duly licensed physician; taken only as prescribed and only for as long as deemed medically reasonable and necessary.  No alcohol; urine screens.  No contact with the Sunglass Hut - North, 2500 North Mayfair Road, Wauwatosa, Wisconsin.
Undergo a mental health evaluation; follow through with any treatment recommended.
Seek and maintain employment. Be given job and vocational training. Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.

Court ordered defendasnt to provide DNA sample.  
Pay the DNA surcharge, plus the costs, disbursements and supervision fees.  Should defendant get revoked, Court ordered monies taken from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy.  Court set restitution at zero.

timeConds.notes:
60 days time to be served at the House of Correction, with Huber for work; and for verifiable medical appointments/counseling (no more than two per week.)  Court stayed report date to:  7/8/14 by 5:00 p.m.   Court STAYED the additional 60 days to be used at the discretion of the agent for any violations.
**Court does allow good time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip Barnes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
INVOICE 
FORWARDED TO ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT, IN THE AMOUNT OF $843.75 to Dr. Pankiewicz for services on 05-04, 05-05, 05-06 & 05-20-14.
COPY IN FILE.
Addition to entry of 7/01/14:  Court DID allow Good Time.

Defendant Phillip Barnes in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds, defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Phillip Barnes in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is here on the return on the doctor's report, which does not support a special plea.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.  File retained in court.
/filed. rn

Defendant Phillip Barnes in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Jay R Pucek appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was called; plea colloquy began; defendant had questions for his attorney and at defense counsel's request, Court passed case.  Case recalled.    Defense counsel indicated she may be pursuing a special plea (not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect) on behalf of defendant and requested that her client be examined by Dr. Pankiewicz of the Forensic Unit.  Secretary set defendant's appointment for May 5, 2014 at 1:30 p.m. with Dr. Pankiewicz  in Room 504 of the Safety Building.  Court ordered case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 20.  All conditions of bail continue.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Phillip Barnes in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  James W Frisch appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to lateness in the hour (defense counsel was in other courts) and the fact that the defendant was not feeling well, defense counsel requested a brief adjournment.  Justice Point report addressed; Court warned defendant that he must comply with all terns of bail as set by this court.  Court granted defense request for adjournment and continued all terms and conditions of bail.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Amended Order allowing defendant for release for funeral, provided he provide verification to Justice Point and they approve same.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.

Defendant Phillip Barnes in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.Court ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/from Justice Point, filed. rn
AMENDED Order for Supervision, signed and filed. Copy provided to defendant.

Defense counsel requested that the GPS Monitoring Order be modified to allow defendant release to attend verifiable mental health appointments, SSI office as well.  All other conditions of bail continue.

Defendant Phillip Barnes in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  rn  Defense counsel requested another date for scheduling, to go over offer and discovery.  Court granted defense request.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM006835  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/11/14 vf
Court orders other terms and conditions to remain the same.
Stipulation to a bail modification is  agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.   Bail AMENDED to $1,000 CASH.

Defendant Phillip Barnes in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Phillip Barnes in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Motion and Motion to Reduce Bail

Oral No Contact Order with MAYFAIR MALL.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers WITH Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW).
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Phillip Barnes in court with attorney Brian B Burke.  Defendant Phillip Barnes in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
